entry.title: Re: how to get the current week from calendar date
entry.content:
For information, WEEK() function only returns the calendar week, not the fiscal week, which is often different depending on the organization's fiscal year setup. To get the fiscal week, you need to reference SAP’s factory calendar or use custom logic based on your fiscal year variant. Of course, in SAP, fiscal weeks are not stored directly but you can derive from Fiscal Year Variants like K4 or V3.

May be you can consider to use Function Module DATE_TO_PERIOD_CONVERT which converts a calendar date into a fiscal period and fiscal year based on your company code and fiscal variant.

entry.title: Embedded Analytics - How to Analyze System/Browser/Network Performance ?
entry.content:
How to Analyze System Performance in Embedded Analytics ?

You can analyze your system performance using the Measurement Tool, or viewing a variety of stories that provide statistics and analysis.

 

To access the tool, from the side navigation, choose  System  -   Measurement Tool.

Client Test Score

The client test runs several scripts on the local machine and calculates a normalized score. Using current best practices, the client score can be categorized as follows:

  • Excellent: Score >= 75
  • Good: Score >= 50 and <75
  • Poor: Score < 50

Bandwidth measures the megabits per second (Mbps) transferred from server to client when downloading and uploading data. A higher bandwidth number is better than a lower number.

To improve your client score while keeping your existing hardware configuration, watch out for CPU intensive applications and processes that may have a negative impact on your SAP Analytics Cloud performance. For example:
  • Business video conferencing services
  • Virus scanning
  • Synchronizing shared network drives

Network Test Score

Latency is measured in milliseconds (ms). It describes the time it takes from the starting request until the response arrives. A good latency is a ping rate within a low milliseconds range.

The network score may be negatively affected by other applications consuming the bandwidth, various network configurations, or different network issues. For example:
  • Virtual Private Networks (VPN)
  • Firewalls
  • Corporate bandwidth
  • Internet bandwidth
  • Database performance (live data connections)
  • SAML IdP logon time

Optimize System Performance with the Analysis Tool

As an administrator of an SAP Analytics Cloud tenant, you can use the Performance Analysis Tool and the decision tree below to find resources that will help you resolve performance issues.

Who does this apply to?
  • Users with Read and Update permissions for System Information.
  • Admin and BI Admin standard application roles.

The following instructions apply primarily to SAP Analytics Cloud (public and private). Some sections may also be applicable to SAP Analytics Cloud, Embedded edition depending on feature availability.

Use the Performance Decision Tree

Follow the steps in the following decision tree to find resources that will help you to resolve performance issues.

This image is interactive. Hover over each area for a description. Click highlighted areas for more information.

 Guidance on Performance Testing

Caution

According to the General Terms and Conditions for SAP Cloud Services it is prohibited to perform any action on the cloud service which circumvents or endangers its operation or security.


Please note, performance testing might have a serious effect on private instances as well as on shared instances where the SAP Analytics Cloud tenant resides with multiple customer tenants on same instance. This is important because services being used on a certain system are shared among other customers. Due to that reason, performing stress or performance testing is only allowed on SAP Analytics Cloud Private Edition tenants.
  • When in doubt, reach out to your Account Team (Account Executive or Customer Success Professional) to clarify whether you are allowed to do the performance test or not.
  • Understand that the performance and specifications of non-production environments may not be the same as production environments. UAT performance testing cannot be performed on non-production systems.
  • As this is considered a support operation please notify SAP (through your Account Team) at least 15 business days in advance of the test so we can monitor the systems to avoid any outage.
Caution

A general stress test might create a load that could endanger the operation of the cloud service.

entry.title: Re: No message determination schema entered in settlement...
entry.content: It seems, the output procedure is not assigned to the document type 0S34. If it is working for other document types like 0S12, 0S14, 0S32, I presume, the output procedure is assigned. Check in SPRO → Sales and Distribution → Billing → Output Determination → Output Determination Using BRF+ → Assign Output Determination Procedure to Billing Type or SPRO → Logistics → Agency Business → Settlement → Output Determination → Assign Output Procedure to Settlement Document Type and check for your document type 0S34 whether the output procedure is assigned.

entry.title: Re: Use of Settlement Material in SAP S/4HANA Condition Contract
entry.content:
HI @MichaelWerner ,

Thank you for your thoughtful and detailed feedback. I completely agree that the material number plays a crucial role in CO-PA and margin analysis, especially for clients where transaction-specific reporting is vital. Your point about extending the settlement item with a custom field to combine both settlement material and the underlying transaction’s material number as split criteria is very insightful. This hybrid approach does indeed offer flexibility to meet diverse business needs and ensures more granular analytics.

entry.title: Re: Dunning notices will not print
entry.content: If the master data and valid email are maintained but still you have the issue, then, probably, you should check Form template assignment in OPD. Even if OPD is set to email, SAP still needs a form template to generate the dunning notice. If the form is missing or inactive, the system cannot render the output. Please check in Output Parameter Determination → Dunning whether a valid form template is linked and the form is active and released in SFP tcode

entry.title: Re: the G/L account of Transaction key JOC for tax code F...
entry.content: First, ensure, this JOC is assigned to your tax condition type in your pricing procedure. Next go to vk13, input your tax condition type and ensure, the tax code F4 only is assigned as indicated by you. Next go to ob40, select this JOC and ensure the correct G/L account is changed there. If the changed G/L Account is there, retest with a new sales order

entry.title: Restrict documents based on legal entities in ONB 2.0
entry.content:
Hi All,

We have a requirement where HR want to see the new hires documents based on legal entity or country. For Eg : India HR should see only documents submitted by India new hires and US HR should see only documents submitted by US new hires & the same way for Germany , Ireland etc.

Please let me know how to achieve this requirement which is in ONB 2.0

Thanks

Vijay

entry.title: Everify
entry.content:
Hi

For US, it’s a federal requirement for our Onboarding Admins to verify the work authorization for all new West employees. In cases where a reverification is needed for these documents, say in case of an immigrant visa, a “Reverification” is required. This reverification can be triggered after months or even years after the start date of the new hire, depending on the expiry date of the current work authorization documents. These reverification requests are currently being routed to the Onboarding admin who originally processed their verification, and it causes an issue when that team member is now termed.

We are checking the feasibility of routing all these reverification requests to a super admin ID in Onboarding by default. The requests can then be triaged/ assigned to the active team members from the concerned site and this will ensure we don’t lose visibility to these reverification cases.

Thanks

Vijay

entry.title: Re: SAP Mail issues - tcode S000 - Locked user appearing...
entry.content: For information, transaction S000 pulls the data from table USR02 which contains all user master records. Having said that, by default, SAP does not filter out locked users in the internal user search within transaction S000. There is no standard configuration to restrict this. If you need this requirement desperately, may be you can go with screen enhancement or implicit enhancement in the search logic. Discuss with your ABAP team and see that the logic be to apply a filter on USR02-UFLAG = 0 to exclude locked users.

entry.title: Re: Capturing Pricing with 4 Decimal Places in Sales Orders
entry.content: Consider calculating the unit price per 100 piece instead of one piece, so that you will get the exact net value.

entry.title: SAP Columbus Q3 meet up highlights
entry.content: In this quarter (Q3—July to Sept) we had two meetups. Both were face-to-face meetups. The purpose of these events was purely networking. For the few members who had never joined any face-to-face meetup, the present was the time to meet face-to-face with them. @Satishjain68 joined a face-to-face meeting for the first time. He is a very senior SAP leader in Columbus with more than 30 years of experience. A few people joined at my request, but they have not yet joined the Columbus SAP group on the SAP website. In the meetup, we get to know each other, the job market at Ohio State, each other's families, and their career backgrounds. Overall, it was a meetup where we had more than 150 years of combined work experience. We had some excellent food and drinks. Everyone enjoyed it. In the upcoming days, we will plan a meetup to discuss the latest SAP innovations. Distinguished Lecture Series on various SAP topics and research and participation in policymaking in the USA,

Groups:

Roles:

Gopi

entry.title: Clarification on SAP Certification Exam Retake Policy
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
I’m seeking clarification regarding the SAP certification exam retake policy. Specifically, I’ve come across the following statement:
“In case an exam is not passed on the first try, please note that you can take the same exam up to three times. If you have failed an exam three times for the same version, you will have to wait until a new version is released. This limitation applies to all subscriptions you have purchased and is cross-checked. Each try counts as one attempt.”
Could someone please confirm if this is the official policy and point me to the source where this is documented (preferably on learning.sap.com or sap.com)?
Thank you in advance!
Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Clarification on SAP Certification Exam Retake Policy
entry.content: @Borivoje_Milosavljevic A candidate who fails an SAP Certification exam may retake it two more times (for a total of three attempts). Upon the third failure, the candidate must wait until the next version of the exam is available before attempting it again. This waiting period is typically several months. This rule is enforced across all exam delivery modes and exam types

entry.title: Re: Custom field in EPPM WBS structure
entry.content:
Hello @FranciscoCosta 

My apologies for the late reply,😊

If you only see the Properties tab, it means you’re not working on a measure. In Custom Analytical Queries (CAQ), the Aggregation and Expression tabs are visible only for measures, not for characteristics.

How to activate Average.

  1. In Custom CDS Views, define an Analytical Cube based on your data source and include your numeric custom field as a measure, setting a default aggregation such as Sum, Max, or Min.
  2. Publish the cube, then add a Calculated Measure in Custom Analytical Queries and set Exception aggregation converted to average, using a reference characteristic such as Project/PROJ or Work. Breakdown Structure (WBS).

You also refer to the below-mentioned official SAP Documentation

  • SAP Help – Custom Analytical Queries (features incl. calculated measures & exception aggregation). SAP Help Portal-Custom Analytical Queries and Services
  • SAP Help/Tutorial – Building CAQ with Calculated Measures and Exception Aggregation. SAP-Create Custom Analytical Queries With Calculated Measures
  • SAP Help – Create Analytical Cube in Custom CDS Views (make the field a measure first). SAP Help Portal-Creating a Cube
  • KBA 2544478 – fields must have an aggregation in the CDS to be usable as measures in CAQ. SAP Support Portal-2544478 - Custom CDS View Fields Don't Appear in Custom Analytical Queries

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Self Service Procure cookbook doesn't describe how th...
entry.content:
Hello @Robson1 

To make the internal Employee Catalogue show in My Purchase Requisitions – New (F1639A)

Assign the catalogue to the user by setting the user's Default Procurement in Default Settings under Users, Purchase Requisitions. Catalogue. SAP Help Portal-Default Settings for Users

Index the items by running the Schedule Import of Catalogue Data, which loads and indexes internal catalogue items to make them visible in Cross-Catalogue Search. SAP Help Portal-Schedule Import of Catalogue Data

Authorisations/app: Give the user the PR app My Purchase Requisitions – New (F1639A) via the appropriate business role, like Employee Procurement. Troubleshoot if items still don’t appear

Follow KBA: internal catalogue items not appearing in Cross-Catalogue Search? Re-run the import or indexing job. SAP Support Portal-2680363 - Internal catalogue items can't be found in Cross-Catalogue Search - SAP S/4HANA

No PA30/PPOMA or table modifications are needed in Public Cloud.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Sales Order as Custom Fields do not work
entry.content:
Hello @lamtq 

Your approach is correct; the issue is typically related to enablement/publishing or writing to an incorrect structure. Follow these steps:

 Enable the field for the app and publish

In Custom Fields & Logic, navigate to YY1_SALESORDERPURRQ Business Context: Procurement: Purchase Requisition Item.

Tick UIs & Reports (include Process Purchase Requisitions – V2) and Publish. Then Adapt UI in the app to place the field. SAP Help Portal-App Extensibility: Process Purchase Requisitions

Implement the appropriate BAdI and record it in the change structure.

Use BAdI: Change of Purchase Requisition Item (MM_PUR_S4_PR_MODIFY_ITEM).

Fill PurchaseRequisitionItemChange-YY1_SALESORDERPURRQ from PURCHASEREQACCASSGNMT_TABLE. Exit after the first hit.

IF purchase requisition item change-yy1_salesorderpurrq IS INITIAL.

  LOOP AT purchasereqaccassgnmt_table INTO DATA(acc)

       WHERE salesdocument IS NOT INITIAL.

    "Optional: restrict to account assignment 'E' (Sales Order)

    IF acc-accountassignmentcategory = 'E'.

      purchaserequisitionitemchange-yy1_salesorderpurrq = acc-salesdocument.

      EXIT.

    ENDIF.

  ENDLOOP.

ENDIF.

Test correctly

Activate the implementation and create a new PR item with account assignment linked to a Sales Document; note that the BAdI does not retroactively populate existing PRs.

Check, SAP API Hub: BAdI MM_PUR_S4_PR_MODIFY_ITEM – Change of Purchase Requisition Item. Business Accelerator Hub-Change of Purchase Requisition Item

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Re: Integrated Financial Planning OPEX Cost Rates Data Ac...
entry.content:
Hi SANA 11,

please look at the lines before:

DATA([d/Measures] = #COST, [d/Date] = #T1, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/ALLOCATION_ACCOUNT], [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D")
= RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT", [d/Date] = #T1, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D")// Check, that allocation account is valid
DATA([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = #IS_ALLOC_ACCOUNT_VALID)
= (RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #COST, [d/Date] = #T1, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/ALLOCATION_ACCOUNT], [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D") * 0 + 1)
+ (RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT", [d/Date] = #T1, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D") * 0 + 1) - 1

The trick is the * 0+1 . For a given d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT, 
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = #IS_ALLOC_ACCOUNT_VALID)
is either 1 (in case [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/ALLOCATION_ACCOUNT] is a valid account and therefore the #COST term is not Null and the 1 + 1 - 1 = 1) or 0 (in case [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/ALLOCATION_ACCOUNT] is not a valid account and therefor the #COST term is Null - the the first +1 is not added )

When you calculate RESULTLOOKUP() + 1, the 1 is only added to existing values, not to Null values!
RESULTLOOKUP()*0 + 1 is a trick to mark all existing data lines with a 1.

Hope this helps.
Hartmut

entry.title: Re: Couldn't subscribe to SAP Build Process Automation: S...
entry.content:
Hi everyone, hi ,I have found this SAP Note with the solution: 

3203062 - Couldn't subscribe to SAP Build Process Automation

Resolution

You can resolve the issue by:

  • Create another subaccount for SBPA
  • Delete your IRPA subscription on your subaccount
  • Enable the [Maintenance Mode] for your IRPA subscription

    See Also

    SAP Help Portal Documentation for SAP Build Process Automation

    Administration Guide for SAP Build Process Automation

     

    I will follow those instructions. 

    Many thanks!

entry.title: Re: Managed with additional save with full data implemena...
entry.content:
Hello @Gurumoorthy 

The underlying cause of the error
You’re combining EML updates within a managed BO with a manual SQL UPDATE in save_modified. During RAP’s save process, the transactional buffer is reapplied, causing your direct database changes to be overwritten. This explains why they save but then disappear. Using COMMIT ENTITIES inside handlers or savers is also not permitted in managed RAP.

Fix recommended: pure managed

Make sure the updatable entity directly maps to your Z-persistent table, without joining billing tables; use associations for reading headers and items.

In your action handler, only update through EML and eliminate the save_modified SQL.

MODIFY ENTITIES OF z_bo IN LOCAL MODE

  ENTITY z_item

  UPDATE FIELDS ( field1 field2 field3 )

  WITH VALUE #( FOR k IN keys

    ( key1 = k-key1 key2 = k-key2

      field1 = lw_wa-field1 field2 = lw_wa-field2 field3 = lw_wa-field3 ) )

  FAILED lt_failed REPORTED lt_reported.

Do not call COMMIT ENTITIES; RAP commits for you.

Alternative, managed with additional save
If you genuinely require logic in save_modified, avoid using EML in the action. Instead, write directly in save_modified using the framework’s create, update, and delete tables, ensuring reported and failed are properly filled.

Also correct.x

Your snippet assigns field1 three times—set field1/field2/field3 correctly.

Keys in WITH VALUE #(… ) must match the BO primary keys.

Below are some SAP Useful documentation references

COMMIT ENTITIES, when it’s permitted (on the consumer side) and explicitly restricted inside behaviour handlers.
SAP Help: COMMIT ENTITIES. SAP Help Portal-ABAP Keyword Documentation

Implementing the Additional Save (save_modified): Proper Usage of Additional and Unmanaged Save Methods in a managed BO.
SAP Help: Implementing Additional Save / save_modified. SAP Help Portal-Implementing Additional Save

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Tax mismatch in accounting and billing document due to downpayment SK VAT change
entry.content:
Hello,

We received downpayment from a customer in March 2024. SK VAT at that time was 20%

In January 2025, VAT rate changed to 23%

In July 2025 when invoice was posted, system generated difference in tax amount in Accounting and Billing document,

In Accounting document, system reversed with entire downpayment amount with 20% and charged new tax of 23% on entire invoice

Whereas the billing document shows 23%charged on the Balance amount post deducting downpayment.

What might be the issue. Condition types are well maintained in VK11

SAP Tax Classification and Reporting #Downpayments #SKVAT

entry.title: FI313 in FX Valuation
entry.content:
Our organization has the funds management activated. Besides FMDERIVE, we have some rules in FMTFDERIVE, where system adds 2 additional lines (DR and CR) to each entries posted to certain internal order types.

The problem is that if an invoice is posted in US dollars for example, to one of these internal orders, when we run FX Valuation, the system takes in consideration these additional two lines in the entry, but cannot apply the configuration we have in FMDERIVE, and we end up with error FI313 - No Funds Center entered/derived in item XXXX.

When I do a trace in FMDERIVE, the additional lines posted in the internal order via FMTFDERIVE, come with no Process or Event populated, and obviously the derivation rules are not followed. 

I wonder if anyone had this scenario and how it can be corrected? Or is this something that SAP should look at and make some changes in FX Valuation to account for this particular situation?

We are on S4HANA.

Thanks,

Monica

entry.title: Re: Automatic Batch/Serial No Determination in vl01n
entry.content:
Hello @KiranSAP3 

The correct Public-Cloud approach is that VL01N and classic exits are not available in the S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Automatic batch determination

Set up batch search for deliveries by activating Automatic Batch Determination for the relevant delivery item categories. Then, develop your search strategy, including condition tables, access sequence, strategy type, search procedure, and condition records. This configuration enables automatic selection during delivery creation. SAP Help Portal-Batch Determination for Deliveries  

Serial numbers -auto-assign from your custom list

Use the standard Outbound Delivery A2X API (version 2) to push serials into the delivery item. The API exposes operations like AddSerialNumberToDeliveryItem (and delete). Set up a communication arrangement (scenario SAP_COM_0106) and call the endpoint for each item with your serials from the custom table.

SAP Help Portal-Outbound Delivery (A2X)  

SAP API Business Hub-Outbound Delivery

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

In Public Cloud, you cannot utilise USEREXIT_BATCH_DETERMINATION or traditional BAdIs for inserting serial numbers. Instead, use configuration settings for batches and the OData API for serial numbers.

entry.title: Re: SAP PO Output Form – Requirement to Consolidate Line...
entry.content:
Hello @Jagdish1 

Here is the specific answer to your question regarding the PO form in S/4HANA Public Cloud

Standard form: Use the pre-delivered Adobe form MM_PUR_PURCHASE_ORDER through Output Management (OPD). Copy it into Maintain Form Templates, then adjust.

SAP Support Portal-3008187 - Purchase Order Output Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

SAP Community-Here’s the PO-form–specific answer for S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition:

Add fields: Create new fields in Custom Fields & Logic within the business context Purchasing Document. Enable these fields for the Purchase Order form, publish the changes, and then add them to your copy of the form. SAP Learning-Using Custom Fields and Logic

Data not included in the PO budget figures: Forms cannot invoke CDS/APIs during printing. First, bring the values into the PO by saving them in custom fields with Custom Logic, then proceed to print. If additional data is required on the print data source, refer to the data source extension approach 

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: The user wants a warning popup message to appear afte...
entry.content:
Hello @Amit66 

A warning pop-up for field input is not supported. Key-user extensions cannot connect a modal dialogue to changes in a header field within the billing UI (VF01 isn’t available in Public Cloud; instead, use the Create Billing Documents (F0798) app).

You can configure a warning message to appear during Save/Check through the Sales Billing “check before save” Cloud Badi. This message will display in the Fiori message area, allowing users to continue, or, if preferred, you can set it as an error to prevent saving.

How to implement

Create the custom field in Custom Fields & Logic under the Sales: Billing Document context, enable it for the UI, and then publish.h.

Implement the Sales Billing check BAdI in Custom Logic; if the custom date is entered, display a warning message: Please re-verify the Date.

(Optional) Utilise Situation Handling to send proactive notifications when the date violates a rule after posting.

Useful SAP documentation

Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) for Sales Billing , lists the billing BAdIs you implement in Custom Logic, including check BAdIs. SAP Help Portal-Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) for Sales Billing

With regards

Chuma

!MM03!

Thank you& Best Regards!

Wang

entry.title: Introducing eslint-plugin-better-cap-config an ESLint plugin to improve CAP configuration
entry.content:
I've created an ESLint plugin to validate the configurations in SAP CAP Node.js applications. Yes, eslint-plugin-better-cap-config validates JSON files containing project configuration. For now, it's basically the usage of deprecated key/value entries, but it can evolve to accommodate best practices, suggestions and autofixes just like any other ESLint plugin.

It's build for modern ESLint which has introduced the concept of new languages. This offers proper support to more languages beyond JavaScript and TypeScript. eslint-plugin-better-cap-config leverages the new JSON Language rather than generic regular expressions. This makes it more powerful and flexible.

 

Demo time

Let's assume we have a simple CAP project with the following configuration in the package.json file.

"cds": {
    "requires": {
      "destinations": true,
      "html5-repo": true,
      "[production]": {
        "auth": "ias"
      },
      "messaging": {
        "kind": "enterprise-messaging"
      },
      "db": {
        "kind": "sql",
        "[production]": {
          "kind": "hana"
        }
      }
    },
    "features": {
      "cds_validate": false,
      "odata_new_adapter": false
    },
    "fiori": {
      "draft_compat": true
    }
  },

 

And the following ESLint configuration:

import cds from '@sap/cds/eslint.config.mjs';
export default [ ...cds.recommended ];

 

As we can see, it's using the ESLint config that comes with @SAP/cds. The same you get from $ cds add lint. OK, let's lint the project and see what happens:

npm run lint

ESLint shows no errors

 

Nothing. No output. No issues. No problems. Happy days, right?

Aladdin says "Not so fast Jafar!"

 

According to the CAP documentation, configuration like cds.features.cds_validate = false, cds.features.odata_new_adapter = false and cds.fiori.draft_compat = true are deprecated. For some of the deprecated config in CAP, you may get a message on the console when running the application (cds-serve, cds watch, etc). However, there are some problems with relying on those console messages:

  1. Most of the time they go unnoticed;
  2. If you don't upgrade @sap/cds and @sap/cds-dk, you won't get the new messages informing something has been deprecated;
  3. No visual cues on IDEs;
  4. Not possible to integrate to a CI/CD pipeline.

In this example, executing cds-serve doesn't return any warning or error messages on the console for the aforementioned deprecated configs.

 

ESLint Plugin Better CAP Config to the rescue!

Now, let's install and configure eslint-plugin-better-cap-config to see what changes. Using it is quite simple, it's just another ESLint plugin you need to add to your collection. Because it uses the JSON language, you need to install the @eslint/json package as well.

npm i -D @eslint/json   eslint-plugin-better-cap-config

 

Edit, the eslint.config.js file (or whatever variation you're using, eg, *.ts or *.mjs) to include eslint-plugin-better-cap-config.

import cds from "@sap/cds/eslint.config.mjs";
import { defineConfig } from "eslint/config";
import json from "@eslint/json";
import capConfig from "eslint-plugin-better-cap-config";

export default defineConfig([
  {
    files: ["**/*.js"],
    extends: [cds.recommended],
  },
  {
    files: ["**/*.json"],
    plugins: {
      json,
    },
    language: "json/json",
    extends: [capConfig.configs.recommended],
  },
]);

 

Now, we execute ESLint just like we did before, nothing else is required.

npm run lint

ESLint shows CAP config errors

 

We can see eslint-plugin-better-cap-config picked up a few deprecated configs that went unnoticed before.

Now, we fix our config:

  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "destinations": true,
      "html5-repo": true,
      "[production]": {
        "auth": "ias"
      },
      "messaging": {
        "kind": "enterprise-messaging"
      },
      "db": {
        "kind": "sql",
        "[production]": {
          "kind": "hana"
        }
      }
    },
    "features": {
      "cds_validate": true,
      "odata_new_adapter": true
    }
  },

 

And lint the project again:

npm run lint

ESLint shows no errors

 

No issues found! Hooray!!!

This is early days for eslint-plugin-better-cap-config, there are few rules implemented so far and some others cooking.

It works with configuration in any JSON file, such as package.json and .cdsrc.json.

CAP documentation is good, but doesn't help much when looking for deprecated stuff. A central place for that would be great. Right now, I'm going through the release notes and looking for everything that's deprecated. It's a rather tedious process...

As always, the project is open-source (GitHub) and PRs are welcome 🤖

entry.title: Re: Electronic Invoicing in Malaysia
entry.content:
Dear All,

 

Good day.

May i know how do we put in multiple original invoices into FV70 if we want to create the debit note(FV70) against multiple original invoices?

We have checked with IRBM and as per IRBM requirement(stated in the FAQ, https://www.hasil.gov.my/media/0xqitc2t/lhdnm-e-invoice-general-faqs.pdf as well), we must put in all the original invoices, instead of only 1.

Currently, we can only put 1 of the original invoice into the FV70's reference field (Inv.Ref.).

 

FAQ that mention about the CN to multiple original e-invoices:

45. Can taxpayers issue one (1) credit note e-Invoice to adjust multiple original e-Invoices?
Yes, taxpayers can make adjustments to multiple original e-Invoices by issuing one (1) single
credit note / debit note / refund note e-Invoice, as the case may be. Note that adjustments can
also be made to consolidated e-Invoices.
Where multiple original e-Invoices are being adjusted in the same credit note / debit note /
refund note e-Invoice, the IRBM Unique Identifier Number of each original e-Invoice must be
indicated in the ‘Original e-Invoice Reference Number’ data field. Taxpayers who are
transmitting via API are reminded to refer to the SDK for the appropriate code to be input.
If adjustments are to be made to original invoices that were issued prior to the implementation
of e-Invoice (i.e., no IRBM Unique Identifier Number has been assigned), taxpayers are then
allowed to input “NA” in the ‘Original e-Invoice Reference Number’ data field.

entry.title: Re: Need to Create SAP ID

entry.title: Re: New Pipeline Concept features: new partner id definition, alternative partner, bypass option
entry.content:
Hi @alex_bundschuh :

In the recently released pipeline update for Generic v2 Outbound Processing Step 06 IFlow, we have to update partner directory for receiver/interface determination as string parameters which was not the case in earlier version of pipeline flow for point to point scenarios. We do not have any custom exits and  readCustomXFromPD Groovy script adds a dependency on the partner ID.

It is also a blocker in P2P scenarios for Edge Integration Cell as Partner Directory is not available yet.

Regards,

Vishal

entry.title: Production order confirmation excess yield quantity - additional line to backflush
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am facing issue during the production order confirmation, (order qty. 100, yield qty. 120) the yield quantity is more than the order quantity, hence the backflush components are consuming extra and the system proposes an additional line to backflush more quantity for the components. For the additional quantity, getting COGI error. Here the backflush components maintained as gram at order level and maintained as pounds at stock level.

Please explain, how to fix this.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Re: RM07DOCS dumped with TSV_TNEW_PAGE_ALLOC_FAILED
entry.content: @newguy_cloud Tell your BA: While just using plants might have worked in the past for smaller data volumes, our system now contains many years of data. To ensure the transaction runs successfully, we must provide a date range to limit the amount of data the program has to process in memory.

entry.title: Re: EWM/S4 inventory discrepancy
entry.content: @JACK-ZHANG Use Transaction /SCWM/MON (EWM Monitor) to check the stock for batch A00001 in Storage Type 1040. Check both the Bin Stock and the Stock in Queue (you already know it's 10 in the queue).                  Use Transaction MMBE (Stock Overview) for batch A00001 and plant. Check the stock in storage location FG01. It will likely show 0 (as per your point 3).This confirms the discrepancy: EWM thinks it owns 10 units (in queue), S/4HANA shows 0 units in FG01.

entry.title: Re: Duplicate Records in Datasphere Monitor – Replication...
entry.content:
Hello,

We also faced the same duplication issue in replication flow for I_PLANT CDS View.

To resolve this issue - Please implement all the notes listed in the current version of note 3254953 to S4P. This includes the TCI note 3581682.
The reasons why it's important to implement all the relevant notes are mentioned in note 2890171 section 6. You can leverage T-code CNV_NA_DI via Note Analyzer(see note 3016862) to automate the examination task, implementing all the missing corrections will make your system more stable and also mitigate the known issues.

There're some enhancements on the source S/4 side, which prevents the duplicate records from being propagated during the data package preparation.

This is the reason need to ensure the prerequisite notes (incl. the TCI note) being implemented beforehand.

Thanks,                                                                                                                                                                              Ankit
